dustmaker package¶

Submodules¶

dustmaker.BitReader module¶

class dustmaker.BitReader.BitReader(data)¶

Bases: object

Allows integers to be read in little endian byte order from a sequence of bytes.

align(size=8)¶

Aligns the bit stream to a given multiple of bits. Default alignment is 8-bit alignment.

size – The desired bit alignment.

more()¶

Returns true if there are more bits to be read.

read(bits, signed=False)¶

Reads the next bits bits into an integer in little endian order.

bits – The number of bits to read. signed – Indicates if the MSB is a sign bit.

read_bytes(num)¶

Returns a bytes object containing the next num bytes from the bit stream.

num – The number of bytes to extract from the bit stream.

skip(bits)¶

Skips bits bits in the bit stream.

bits – the number of bits to skip.

dustmaker.BitWriter module¶

class dustmaker.BitWriter.BitWriter¶

Bases: object

Allows integers to be written in little endian byte order into a bytes object.

align(size=8)¶

Aligns the bit stream to a given multiple of bits. Default alignment is 8-bit alignment.

size – The desired bit alignment.

byte_count()¶

Returns the number of bytse written so far.

bytes()¶

Returns a bytes object containing all written data so far.

write(bits, val)¶

Writes val as a bits bit integer in little endian order to the bit stream.

bits – The number of bits in val. val – The value of the integer.

write_bytes(data)¶

Write the bytes given by data to the stream.

data – The bytes to write to the stream.

dustmaker.Map module¶

class dustmaker.Map.Map(parent=None)¶

Bases: object

Represents a Dustforce level.

A map contains the following attributes:

map.tiles - A dict mapping (layer, x, y) to Tile objects. map.props - A dict mapping prop ids to Prop objects. map.parent - For backdrops this is the containing map. Otherwise this is

set to None.

If the map is not a backdrop (i.e. map.parent == None) then the following attributes will also be available:

map.entities - A dict mapping entity ids to Entity objects. map.backdrop - The backdrop Map object. Backdrop maps can only contain

tiles and props and each tile is the size of 16 tiles in the top level coordinate system.
map.vars - A raw mapping of string keys to Var objects. Some of these
variables have nicer accessors like map.name(...).
map.sshot - The level thumbnail image. This appears to be a PNG image
with some custom or missing header.
add_entity(x, y, entity, id=None)¶

Adds a new entity to the map and returns its id.

x - The x position in tile units of the entity. y - The y position in tile units of the entity. entity - The Entity object to add to the map. id - The entity identifier. If set to None the identifier will be

allocated for you.

Raises a MapException if the given id is already in use.

add_prop(layer, x, y, prop, id=None)¶

Adds a new prop to the map and returns its id.

x - The x position in tile units of the prop. y - The y position in tile units of the prop. prop - The Prop object to add to the map. id - The prop identifier. If set to None the identifier will be

allocated for you.

Raises a MapException if the given id is already in use.

add_tile(layer, x, y, tile)¶

Adds a new tile to the map.

layer - The layer to add the tile. x - The x position of the tile. y - The y position of the tile. tile - The tile to add to the map.

Raises a MapException if the given position is already occupied.

delete_tile(layer, x, y)¶

Delete the tile at the given position if present.

layer - The layer to add the tile. x - The x position of the tile. y - The y position of the tile.

get_entity(id)¶

Returns the Entity object with the given id or None.

get_entity_xposition(id)¶

Returns the x position of the entity with the given id or None.

get_entity_yposition(id)¶

Returns the y position of the entity with the given id or None.

get_prop(id)¶

Returns the Prop object with the given id or None.

get_prop_layer(id)¶

Returns the layer of the prop with the given id or None.

get_prop_xposition(id)¶

Returns the x position of the prop with the given id or None.

get_prop_yposition(id)¶

Returns the y position of the prop with the given id or None.

get_tile(layer, x, y)¶

Returns the tile at the given position or None.

layer - The layer to add the tile. x - The x position of the tile. y - The y position of the tile.

merge_map(map, _do_remap_ids=True)¶

Merge a map into this one.

map - The Map to merge into this one.

name(val=None)¶

Returns the level name.

val - If not None sets the new name of the Map.

remap_ids(min_id=None)¶

Remap prop and entity ids starting at min_id.

This calls through to all entities to remap any references to other entity ids.

start_position(val=None, player=1)¶

Returns the starting position of a player as a tuple of floats.

val - If not None sets the new player position. player - The player ID to set the position of.

translate(x, y)¶

Translate the entire map x tiles laterally and y tiles horizontally.

x - The number of tiles to move laterally. If a float tiles will be
moved by the nearest integer.
y - The number of tiles to move horizontally. If a float tiles will be
moved by the nearest integer.
virtual_character(val=None)¶

Returns True if the map uses virtual characters.

val - If not None sets the virtual character flag for the map.

dustmaker.MapException module¶

exception dustmaker.MapException.MapException¶

Bases: Exception

exception dustmaker.MapException.MapParseException¶

Bases: dustmaker.MapException.MapException

dustmaker.MapReader module¶

dustmaker.MapReader.read_map(data)¶

Returns a Map object parsed from data in the Dustforce level format.

data - A sequence of bytes representing a Dustforce level.

On error raises a MapParseException.

dustmaker.MapWriter module¶

dustmaker.MapWriter.write_map(map)¶

Writes a Map object into a sequence of bytes in the Dustforce level format.

Returns a bytes object representing the level.

On error raises a MapException.

dustmaker.Tile module¶

class dustmaker.Tile.Tile(shape, _tile_data=None, _dust_data=None)¶

Bases: object

Represents a single tile in a Dustforce level. Positional information is stored within Map.

edge_angle(side, val=None)¶

Returns the angle of side as a 16 bit integer.

side – The side to get/set edge angle. val – If present a 16 bit integer to set as the new edge angle.

edge_bits(side, val=None)¶

Returns the 4 bit number associated with side surface of the tile. I’m unsure what each bit means currently. Set all to 0 to freely move through that side of the tile and to 0xF to cause collisions.

side – The side to get/set edge bits. val – If present a 4 bit integer to set as the new edge bits.

sprite_palette(val=None)¶

Returns the palette index associated with this tile.

val – If present the new palette index for this tile.

sprite_path()¶

Returns the palette index associated with this tile. You may retrieve the complete game sprites listing from https://www.dropbox.com/s/jm37ew9p74olgca/sprites.zip?dl=0

val – If present the new palette index for this tile.

sprite_set(val=None)¶

Returns the sprite set from TileSpriteSet associated with this tile.

val – If present a TileSpriteSet to set as the new sprite set.

sprite_tile(val=None)¶

Returns the tile index associated with this tile.

val – If present the new tile index for this tile.

class dustmaker.Tile.TileShape¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Tiles come in four main types; full, half, big, and small.

Full corresponds to a complete square tile.

Half corresponds to one of the tiles aligned to 45 degrees that take up half of the tile unit. These come in four varieties A, B, C, and D depicted on the wheel below.

Big and small tiles form the inbetween angles. The big tile variant covers 75% of the tile while the small tile variant covers 25% of the tile. Each of these comes in 8 varieties 1-8 depicted in the wheel below.

To determine the angle of a half, big, or small tile from its shape find its identifier in the wheel. Imagine you were located at X and the + characters formed a circle around you; the angle of the tile would be approximately the angle of the circle surface where its label is.:

         +++++
      +7+     +3+
     +           +
    +             +
   B               C
  +                 +
 +                   +
 2                   6
 +                   +
+                     +
+                     +
+          X          +
+                     +
+                     +
 +                   +
 8                   4
 +                   +
  +                 +
   A               D
    +             +
     +           +
      +1+     +5+
         +++++
